website_summaries.verdict: A great update to a couple of classic birding guides, although its bulky size makes it better on a coffee table than the field.
pros: Combines the Peterson Field Guide to Eastern Birds and Peterson Field Guide to Western Birds into one volume
Updates include new paintings and maps
Also includes access to 3 hours of video podcasts
cons: A little too large and heavy to be a good field guide
it can be hard to locate local birds

customer_reviews.title: Good reference book
customer_reviews.text: This was a selection as our reference for identifying birds, predominately waterfowl, when we moved near a small lake. It is extremely helpful in identifying our permanent residents and those passing through on a migratory pattern. So far it has answered all our questions and the illustrations have been helpful in precisely finding the characteristics necessary to label the visitors and learn more about their habitat. A Peterson guide that will not disappoint. That said, it is hefty book and one you probably wouldn't want to carry around for true birders.
customer_reviews.author: Classy Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Too big and heavy for a field guide
customer_reviews.text: Unquestionably one of the best field guides out there in terms of comprehensiveness and accurate illustrations. The big drawback is that it's too big and heavy to carry in the field except in a backpack. So I had to buy a very similar guide that's a little smaller, and I leave this one at home. It might as well be a coffee table book instead of a field guide. For that reason I'd go with the separate, lighter Eastern and Western guides (or a different guide such at NatGeo's), since the likelihood of spotting a bird outside the one you're carrying is very small.
customer_reviews.author: Poogy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding guide for both the novice and expert bird watcher!
customer_reviews.text: With my Nikon 200-500mm lens, I soon discovered a new interest - bird photography. I had never realized the variety of birds that were in my immediate vicinity. I started wondering what all these birds were. With the Peterson Field Guide to Birds of North America, I immediately started to be able to identify the various birds that I was sighting. The book is very thorough and well done. The quality of the illustrations and printing is first rate. This book is definitely a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Classic Guide
customer_reviews.text: This is the one that started it all, and if you are new to Birding or even an old timer, you can't go wrong with Peterson. This copy went to my 7 year old grandson, he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Frederick J. Spector

customer_reviews.title: Excellent guide
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my bird-watching granddaughter who is 8. She loves it. Especially likes the life list in the back so she can record sightings of birds. She also likes quizzing herself with the bird silhouettes. It's a fabulous book. (Grammy has one too!)
customer_reviews.author: JodyC

customer_reviews.title: Good book with great pictures and info
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good book with a lot of information and pictures of the birds. It's a big book for a field guide and I was expecting more of a pocket book. I gave this to my partner for Christmas to replace one she had lost on a trip and it was much better than the old one. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: bree29

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but beginners will want phone app to get you familiar with common local birds
customer_reviews.text: I carry this in my car with me so I can use it whenever I'm out and about. I usually supplement with an iphone app such Merlin Bird ID until I get more familiar with local birds and where to find them in the book. It can be overwhelming to a new beginner such as myself to solely rely on a book. I use it as a reference once I've identified the most likely species from my phone app.
customer_reviews.author: PF

customer_reviews.title: ***** ROGER TORY PETERSON "WROTE THE BOOK" ON BIRDWATCHING *****
customer_reviews.text: On the 2008 edition: Coming from a family of avid amateur naturalists we have always had the RTP Field Guide to Eastern Birds in our homes and this, the latest edition, which is for the entire continent, is the fitting successor in a series whose originator literally "wrote the book" on birdwatching. With excellent field guides also now available from National Geographic, Sibley, Audubon, Smithsonian & Kaufmann; perhaps Peterson's greatest legacy is the popularization of this foundational natural history avocation to the point that it's devotees can and do support such diversity and quality. TIP: The one page index inside the front cover really makes for that crucial speed that we all need for successful bird identification.
customer_reviews.author: In Memory of W. G. Simms

customer_reviews.title: Good reference book
customer_reviews.text: The book, supposed to be a new book, came with a creased cover, and the lower corner was crumpled. The text was fine, but, since this was a gift, I was disappointed at the condition of the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing/Love it
customer_reviews.text: This book is amazing!! We love it! The book is extremely informative, brite, vibrant, up to date and best of all a hard back book! Our son loves to bird watch and go right to this bwautiful book to quickly identify birds. I defiantly recomend this book for bird watchers. ❤💙💚
customer_reviews.author: Chrystal

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect book for beginners. It is an easy way for people to learn how to enjoy this free and fun activity.
customer_reviews.author: Gale Nixon

customer_reviews.title: No video podcast included
customer_reviews.text: there was no video podcast in this book. Same situation in three other books ordered. The book itself is a great one.
customer_reviews.author: tmb

customer_reviews.title: I love my Peterson field guide!
customer_reviews.text: I lost my Peterson Field Guide a few months ago. I was sorry to lose my lifetime list along with it. After turning the house upside down, I knew I had to get a new one. The beautiful paintings of the birds make the identification easy,for me. It lays on my table with my binocs, ready for quick ID of visitors. Hmm. That long tailed, four footed one is not in the book.😜
customer_reviews.author: IdahoMom

customer_reviews.title: Peterson Field Guide to Birds of North America
customer_reviews.text: This book is a must in any birder's library. Peterson is the king of birders...his knowledge on all birds is unsurpassed. I use this book every day to read and learn more on specific birds and it is easy to read and full of useful tips. If you are new to identifying birds, this book will help you. I recommend this book to new birders and experienced. It is a book to be enjoyed by all, even folks who are not birders...they will soon become excited to enter the world of birding.
customer_reviews.author: Book Worm

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this book! It is packed with great identifying info and photos galore. Worth buying and even gifting!
customer_reviews.author: GoddessOfGoodVibes

customer_reviews.title: Very comprehensive
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised, did some research and this is just right for my needs. Not a “birder” per se but I love to identify those at my feeder and it’s nice to have an in hand book. Good for those who don’t know much to learn A LOT. Very comprehensive.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Douglass

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful! This takes the place of the one I ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful! This takes the place of the one I inherited from my Mother which had become too delicate to take into the field any longer. It is now "retired" and enjoying a well earned life of leisure on the bookshelf. Of all the bird books I have, I regard the Peterson Guide as the best.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Grubb

customer_reviews.title: Partial to Peterson.
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of Peterson's field guides having used them for over 50 years. I prefer drawings to photographs. Way back then the book was small and could be carried around to be used in the field. Now it is twice as large and very heavy. It will have to stay back home as a reference. It is already out-of-date, published in 2008. However, bird ranges are changing rapidly and guides quickly become out-of-date.
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: Great Birdbook
customer_reviews.text: Very good for identifying birds. Get it. You’ll be glad you did. The book has colored tabs and other features that make this book better than most. It also has a life list.
customer_reviews.author: Thunderbird

customer_reviews.title: Best Guide in the Field
customer_reviews.text: I have every Peterson Field Guide pertinent to North America, and this one is the most beautiful yet. We have guests come over and pick it up off the coffee table and look at every page like they're reading a novel. The pictures are so much more detailed and colorful than photographs. If you're a bird watcher like my wife and I, never leave home without your P.F.G., your binocs and your camera & long-range lens. What a hoot!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck'n'em

customer_reviews.title: Great field guide...your second resource in your car or backpack
customer_reviews.text: Although National Geo and Sibley have really raised the bar on bird field guides, I still feel that Peterson's guide is still the best at differentiation birds and, well, basic identification. The only downside to the guide is that it is too big to fit in one's pocket when birding. For that, I would recommend a western or eastern guide, but this full NA version is great to have with you in the backpack or in the car when you need a second opinion and/or additional detail.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Bird Identification Book
customer_reviews.text: This book is very We written and it has beautiful details of all the birds within it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Earl B.

customer_reviews.title: It does have beautiful illustrations of every bird
customer_reviews.text: This is on the verge of being too large to be a field guide. It does have beautiful illustrations of every bird. There are range maps next to each entry but there is a large portion at the end of the book dedicated to range maps for subspecies. I believe that this may be where the book becomes a little large. It does have a checklist at the end where you can out a check next to each species you've seen. Overall, it is comprehensive and includes a lot of info but mag be too large to carry with you on certain outings.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Lys

customer_reviews.title: The Big Paterson Field guid to birds
customer_reviews.text: This book is fantastic but a little big for the field. But if your only carrying one bird guide the weight may be ok for you. Easy references everything seems covered. I was expecting a smaller guide when it arrived this is NOT a pocket edition. It is for your back pack. Great if your sitting or in a blind. I love it so I don't want to get it wet. So it is staying home for now. And it will come out on the sunny days .
customer_reviews.author: suzanne

customer_reviews.title: great book
customer_reviews.text: ordered for a competition on ornithology. had all the information I needed. Beautiful pictures
customer_reviews.author: cal-mom

customer_reviews.title: Full of Valuable information!
customer_reviews.text: I can not say enough good things about this book and book seller! As a beginning birder I find the information, pictures, descriptions, and bird silhouettes so user friendly. I was so excited to get the book much earlier than expected! Thank you Media Mail TN Valley Books!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Drewry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Large, and Heavy (for a Field Guide)
customer_reviews.text: Excellent comprehensive guide to the birds of North America. I agree with others that it is more of a reference than a field guide. It is large and heavy, making it a challenge to carry on long hikes.
customer_reviews.author: djwilliamson2

customer_reviews.title: Best Reference Available!
customer_reviews.text: I love thisbook and use it regularly as a recerence. The illustrations are superb and are an immense help in differentiating birds and their gender.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Berry

customer_reviews.title: Missing something important
customer_reviews.text: "access to stunning podcasts" was missing from this particular book. I order this edition rather than getting the newest edition precisely for this video experience. If you can send it under separate cover or via email - you know how to reach me. difference of 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Susana J Ehlers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bird watchers
customer_reviews.text: This guide is helping me to identify all the birds that visit my yard.
customer_reviews.author: barbara scheppmann

customer_reviews.title: Cover upside down and backwards
customer_reviews.text: Great content to the book but the book cover was upside down and backwards on the book. Ridiculous. Would of got a 5star if they actually cared enough to put the cover on correctly.
customer_reviews.author: JNick

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: It's so nice to have both guides in one volume! I don't have to go digging through my pack for the right one or pull the wrong one from a shelf before I head out hiking. As with all guides, the vinyl bound volume is worth a few extra dollars to protect it against damp and dirt. Other guides are perhaps more comprehensive, but I still rely on Peterson's for the sheer beauty of the paintings.
customer_reviews.author: RomanDruid

customer_reviews.title: Excellent resource
customer_reviews.text: This is best guide to identifying and learning habits, preferreddiet & migration patterns of birds in North America.
customer_reviews.author: KBNP

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: Great book!! Very well detailed and helping me to identify the birds coming around that I'm new at taking photos of.
customer_reviews.author: Mauri A Wade

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and fun
customer_reviews.text: Great book and excellent reference. I use it a lot yo identify birds and it has great pictures and descriptions that make identifying a bird easy and fun. Gave one as a gift too.
customer_reviews.author: CJasper

customer_reviews.title: Great images! Larger format!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know this book was going to be a larger format when I bought it. It's an upgrade from the small format I have been using. It's not real portable for the field. If you are a porch birdwatcher this is the book for you. All the pages are glossy and it is easier to see the larger images. It lays flat and stays opened to your page. The cover is some kind of vinyl and coffee wipes off it very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Very good bird guide
customer_reviews.text: Lovely book, very informative. I like better than the separate Eastern Birds and Western Birds Books. Just me but I like them together. BTW I'm a beginning birder.
customer_reviews.author: Daisysue

customer_reviews.title: An absolut MUST for Bird Watchers
customer_reviews.text: Peterson's Field Guide is the absolute Best for Birders, categorizing birds to make it easy to ID them and great descriptions.
customer_reviews.author: Top Down Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book
customer_reviews.text: Great book for anyone that likes to watch birds. Peterson is a great reference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... this for my husband and it has been a great book to identify many birds
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband and it has been a great book to identify many birds. It is very colorful and well made. You have a list of all the birds in the back so you can write down the date of identification.
customer_reviews.author: Cielo

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This was a great edition. High quality pages. Price exceptional bargin.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Would be heavy to carry in the field
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book to keep around the house. Great material. If you plan on carrying this with you on a backpacking trip or similar excursion, there are many many pages that you would want to remove to cut down on the size. It's more of a reference than a field guide. I sort of knew that when I bought it, so it fits my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: hotelmode

customer_reviews.title: Great condition, better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: It was in great condition and just what I wanted! I know he will love it! Thanks so much.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqulyn

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it highly for anyone just starting out
customer_reviews.text: As a beginning birder this book is fabulous! It points out the subtle differences between similar birds so that I can make a definitive identification. I recommend it highly for anyone just starting out, or working on differentiating species.
customer_reviews.author: Marisol Arteaga

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It covers too much area and is hard to locate area birds.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Fox

customer_reviews.title: bird guide
customer_reviews.text: Peterson field guide to birds arrived in perfect condition. Peterson bird guides are my favorite. Easy to understand and detailed. This one was purchased as a gift. Others have seen my Peterson guide and like it so I give them as gifts now. Greatly appreciate the ability to purchase online. Speedy delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Lili

customer_reviews.title: Peterson Field Guide to Birds of North America (Peterson Field Guides)
customer_reviews.text: A very nice book in fine condition. The pictures are great. The only suggestion I would make is that it may be easier to locate the bird I want to see if they were alphabetically arranged in the book. Like "Yellow birds near the back of the book, blue ones near the front.. OK a dumb suggestion. I do like the book but my knowlege of birds is not great. It's about like Geography to me... Thanks, Pete
customer_reviews.author: Peter Robitaille

customer_reviews.title: A great field guide, inexpensive and better grade than a paperback good
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price, better quality than a paperback. Used in a garden gift basket along with other items.
customer_reviews.author: Josie Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Best field guide to help birders quickly and accurately identify birds in the field.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic field guide. The strength of this guide is its detailed method of identifying birds through specific visible details, called field marks, which the book carefully points out. It's method is the best I've found to help birders quickly and accurately identify birds in the field.
customer_reviews.author: N. Levi

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate field guide for bird watchers
customer_reviews.text: The name speaks for itself! With all of North America in one book, small range maps on each page PLUS more detailed maps in the back, this one has it all.
customer_reviews.author: oomowmow

customer_reviews.title: Audubon Society Get A Break
customer_reviews.text: My old Peterson was nice, but I was missing identifications and emailing Portland Audubon Society to get those birds identified. Can't do without Audubon Society, or the Peterson Field Guide to Birds of North America, Or Amazon for having just what I needed, at a fair price and quick shipping.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Wallbight

customer_reviews.title: Nice book informative with great pictures!
customer_reviews.text: Very detailed information great color pictures! This book is a must have for any bird watcher or nature lover! This was a much wanted gift for my bird watcher armature ornithologist husband. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Ruthann F. Sandberg

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful reference guide
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved to a home with the woods as a backyard, and our Peterson Field Guide is never far away from the back window....really a wonderful book, and has helped us identify lots and lots of birds....highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: History Buffs

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loving this book. Wish I had bought the field guide specifically for my region
customer_reviews.author: Lisa W.

customer_reviews.title: Great bird bictures
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a bird watcher, and I wanted to have my own book when she shows me a new bird. It is probably the best book on the market concerning the Birds of North America.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So good I had to get my own
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these as a gift for my teenage grandson and his turned out to be so much better than my older edition, I simply had to get one for myself. The somewhat larger format for this edition really makes it much better for aging eyesight and the updates are first class. I recommend it whenever I have a chance.
customer_reviews.author: H. B. Zachry

customer_reviews.title: Colorful North American bird field guide
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book for my daughter, she was taking a biology of bird class and needed a field guide on birds. The pictures were were full of color and explanation of each species of bird was very information
customer_reviews.author: Therese

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful photos
customer_reviews.text: Excellent compilation with superb photos and much information, well laid-out, great gift for the bird lover, novice or expert.
customer_reviews.author: Dana P

customer_reviews.title: Very well illustrated
customer_reviews.text: Very well illustrated and comprehensive. Best field guide for identifying birds, especially those that look similar to each other.
customer_reviews.author: William K. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent descriptions but too difficult for amateurs to use in field.
customer_reviews.text: I am a photographer and consistently run into problems identifying birds I see during my hiking/photo outings. I tried taking the book with me (Its the vinyl cover version) but the interruptions required by looking up the birds on site interrupted the experience of enjoying nature and looking for photo opportunities. The book IS very good, with excellent illustrations but, for me, it is too time consuming for inexperienced bird watchers to locate birds in the field. It is very good when I pull up individual photos in Lightroom (v3.6) and can compare the screen display with pictures in the book and add keywords as needed in Lightroom.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ligon

customer_reviews.title: Good guide for begineers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 12 of these for bird 101 classes. They have good illustrations and maps. Species groups are pretty easy to find. Also, the price was right. Are there better guides? Of course! But, these are perfect for my classes.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Hodson

customer_reviews.title: so i'm a geek
customer_reviews.text: i've had bird books since i was a kid and when i couldn't identify one on our feeder, i had to figure it out. remembering peterson's as a favorite of mine, i decided to buy an updated version. one of the better decisions i've made.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky in KCTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A good book but too big for a field guide.
customer_reviews.author: EJPSview

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: If your a bird watcher you have probably already heard of this book. If you are a new watcher this is a great book too get with its exellent pictures and descriptions it will have you keeping your eyes open for the next specimen.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great help for beginning birders.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bird book! Pictures very good, descriptions and zone maps very helpful. It is rather large for field work.
customer_reviews.author: jean henderson

customer_reviews.title: The official source as far as we're concerned.
customer_reviews.text: THE book of birds. Well illustrated and written as prior guides have been.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Bachtel

customer_reviews.title: Excellenty illustrated and accurate descriptions
customer_reviews.text: Like the field guide because I am already familiar with earlier versions of this guide and have been using it for years. This more recent version is updated, well illustrated, and has additional useful information for birders, naturalists and wildlife biologists. Useful for identification and for life history, range, and biological information on all North American species.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Miller

customer_reviews.title: First bird book you should want
customer_reviews.text: Peterson field guides are still the best using the most beautiful pictures and thorough information. We bought this one for our daughter and she is very happy with it and uses it for all her watches.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great book for anyone who watches bird either in their back yard or out in the forest
customer_reviews.author: E Gail

customer_reviews.title: Great guide for all levels of birders
customer_reviews.text: Peterson's guide is a front runner of the genre. The drawn images are pristine with arrows pointing out the distinctives of individual birds. While I do love this guide, it is not the one I carry in the field due to its size. It is an extremely valuable asset when trying to identify difficult birds since it will usually give more than one image per bird. I highly recommend this guide, but as always the more source you have the more likely you are to correctly identify the bird!
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Horse

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent field guide, although I have an iphone, I still love having a book like this. A joy.
customer_reviews.author: Mitzy

customer_reviews.title: Great Reference Book
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd copy of this book I've purchased. Keep on in my home in TX and one in IL. Take one with me when I travel and give it away when I reach my destination. Very interesting and well done!
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Menk

customer_reviews.title: A nice book with pictures
customer_reviews.text: We keep it in the kitchen, overlooking a pond, so we can identify the birds that travel through our Florida neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: Les Ungerleider

customer_reviews.title: Hurrah for old favorite!
customer_reviews.text: Here are the world famous illustrations and added pointers for bird identification along with maps and lots of information on each bird.
customer_reviews.author: Beverley R. Enright

customer_reviews.title: Bird field guide
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned a older version of this field guide. This newer and expanded guide has more information which I found helpful. However, it is larger and not as convenient to carry with you. I'm still getting used to it.
customer_reviews.author: joszoo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. We like this for identifying migrating birds.
customer_reviews.author: margaret kuckuck

customer_reviews.title: Bird Booking
customer_reviews.text: This is an exciting book for birders. I have been able to identify several birds in my area. My daughter and I enjoy birding together. Bonnie Reeves
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie J Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Quality educational guide
customer_reviews.text: It has helped us to understand the birds in our area.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Balka

customer_reviews.title: No better than Peterson
customer_reviews.text: I will make sure this book is with me when I go birding. I love my American Bird Conservancy guide for all the info and good drawings. But on the technical side of identification, Peterson does it best with all those arrows.
customer_reviews.author: anacondapy

customer_reviews.title: All good
customer_reviews.text: It is one of the best bird reference books I have ever seen!
customer_reviews.author: Ken U.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded expectations! Worth its weight in gold for identifying birds correctly!
customer_reviews.author: Nance

customer_reviews.title: Nice pictures, and great information
customer_reviews.text: Given as a gift, and she is an avid bird watcher. Nice pictures, and great information!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully illustrated
customer_reviews.text: The descriptions and photos are absolutely stunning. It even shows what the underside of the bird looks like in flight . Got one for our daughter and son in law also.
customer_reviews.author: SusieQ

customer_reviews.title: Review of Peterson Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice book with good information and nice pics of the birds. I have been using it to identify some of the birds at our feeders this winter. Glad I purchased it. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Brocieus

customer_reviews.title: Most beautiful edition yet
customer_reviews.text: Like many, I regard Roger Tory Peterson as among the most important American naturalists ever. I would tout this edition under any circumstance. However, the larger size has allowed better illustration color and an integration of the range maps into the body of the book. This larger size (over the Western Field Guide's previous edition) may keep me bringing Sibley's into the field, but I'll be coming home to Peterson.
customer_reviews.author: B. Racette

customer_reviews.title: Bird Book
customer_reviews.text: An excellent source of info about all the birds we see in our backyard. Very comprehensive with color photos. We have enjoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Callan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully presented and explained
customer_reviews.text: I love this guide. I have had an older edition and have used it for many years. It is a companion that goes wherever I go and gives me the information I need.
customer_reviews.author: Direxpo

customer_reviews.title: Peterson Field Guide to Birds of North America
customer_reviews.text: The book arrived very quickly and was able to put good use to it immediately. Doing a term paper on nature, this book helped to identify and distinguish different birds while on my hike.
customer_reviews.author: gene

customer_reviews.title: Even better than previous editions.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the earlier editions but lost it while on a trek. I like the new edition even better. I take it with me on all bird-watching treks.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: The best yet!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Roger Tory Peterson's field guides for fifty years. Our original bird book finally fell apart, so I checked out Amazon for a new one. Had I known what I was missing, I would have done so sooner. The new RTP is great! Organization has been improved, the ills are larger and more brilliant, the descriptions are even more precise. I regret the passing of our much-loved old guide, but birding is going to be easier and more pleasurable with the new one.
customer_reviews.author: donjreis

customer_reviews.title: Great Fieldguide
customer_reviews.text: Very nice fieldguide with good ictures. For the novice, it would be nice if it were organized by color of location, but nonetheless it told me what to shoot for.
customer_reviews.author: Evalu8er

customer_reviews.title: Peterson Guide of Birds N.A.
customer_reviews.text: I have a collection of twelve other bird books. Mainly I use this book at my desk to figure out the not sure birds that I have found that day. I like the layout of pages that have look-a-likes together. This makes it much easier for ID. Reviewing the book before you go birding makes things so much better. Good birding to you.
customer_reviews.author: Dane C. Fagundes

customer_reviews.title: Fine, but not the best
customer_reviews.text: Slightly disappointed. Illustrations are small. He crams too many birds on each page.
customer_reviews.author: Yesterday's child

customer_reviews.title: Great Illustration and Not Too Big
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book for carrying with you while you do your bird watching and is attractive enough to have on the coffee table.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew E. Mazur

customer_reviews.title: easy to use for the amateur
customer_reviews.text: not a member of the audobahn society but this guy is doing me a good turn either way
customer_reviews.author: Run With Them Or Fear Them

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent new version with terrific larger illustrations. We had an old copy, tattered and falling apart! This is just ideal as a replacement! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: itserknoddyl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bird Book
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three bird books and this is my favorite. I would highly recommend it. It gives great pictures and a lot of information.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: A-1 bird book
customer_reviews.text: I've never seen an easier bird book to use, or one with more beautiful birds. LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: R.A.

customer_reviews.title: Excllent Filed guide
customer_reviews.text: The picture illustrations are great the guide is well organized and I use it in the field often. I would recommend this guide.
customer_reviews.author: Theron Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Happy Birder
customer_reviews.text: Book was a gift for my Mom who splits her time between two homes. She had left her oldie but goodie bird book at the other house, so I purchased this Peterson guide for her at my house and I'm thrilled. It arrived in a very timely manner, was in great condition, a large book with mangnificient pictures and drawings. She's carrying it with her, following the birds, from front to back of our house. Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Rinn

product_meta.title: Peterson Field Guide to Birds of North America (Peterson Field Guide Series)
